section.para: The following screen will appear if the specified Calendar is a relative Calendar:
When creating a new Calendar Item for a relative Calendar, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Enter a unique name to identify the relative Calendar Item.

note.para: Negative numbers may be used when defining an Offset period in a relative Calendar. This enables you to view data prior to the current period, for example.

listitem.para: Select a value between -999 and 999 using the arrow buttons located to the right of the field. The offset is used to indicate the length of time a period is removed from a given starting point—for example, the current day, the current week, etc. Specify the type of interval to be used for the offset by selecting one from the list in the adjacent field. There are four different offset interval types to choose from: days, weeks, months, and years.

Select a value between 0 and 999 using the arrow buttons located to the right of the field. The period length dictates the length of the specified period. Specify the type of interval to be used for the period by selecting one from the list in the adjacent field. There are four different period interval types to choose from: days, weeks, months, and years.
